'NiCole Robinson' (born April 12, 1972 in Burley, Idaho) is an American stand-up
comedian and actress. Raised in Paul, Idaho, as a member of The Church of Jesus
Christ of Latter-day Saints, she is best known for her portrayal of quirky
secretary Margaret Hooper on [[The West Wing (TV series)|The West Wing]]. She is
also recoginized as playing "The Smoking Woman" on an episode of [[Friends (TV
series)|Friends]]. She started her television acting career on [[Seinfeld (TV
series)|Seinfeld]], playing the waitress at Monk's CafÃ© for 3 episodes.

When asked about why she capitalizes the "C" in her name, she replied, "Why not?
Life is too short to be all lowercase. Seriously, it's what poor people do to
look fancy." http://community.tvguide.com/forum.jspa?forumID=700000061

In 2007, Robinson and her lobbyist husband, Craig Snyder, lost their infant son,
Lincoln, to a rare and fatal genetic lung condition called alveolar capillary
dysplasia. Since then, they have started a memorial fund called The 3 Angels
Memorial Fund for ACD Research. They have one other child together, a daughter
named Shirley, who was born in 2005.

In 2010, NiCole Robinson gave birth to a healthy baby boy named L.J.
